MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG
MovieReviews.Review: Do we really need Megamind when Despicable Me is around?

MovieReviews.ActorName: Noomi Rapace, Michael Nyqvist, Annika Hallin, Lena Endre, Per Oscarsson, Peter Andersson
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R
MovieReviews.Review: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest has such dull patches that as a Volvo races to the scene of a massive shootout, a distracting thought comes to mind: Can Volvos even go that fast?

MovieReviews.ActorName: James Gandolfini, Melissa Leo, Kristen Stewart
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R
MovieReviews.Review: After all those years playing Tony Soprano, James Gandolfini knows his way around a stripper pole.

MovieReviews.MPAARating: R
MovieReviews.Review: Leave it to a preverbal baby and an alert watchdog to figure out there's something creepy going on before the adults do.

MovieReviews.MPAARating: R
MovieReviews.Review: Tamara Drewe is so light, it's almost pure froth.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Matt Damon, Cecile de France, George McLaren, Frankie McLaren, Bryce Dallas Howard, Jay Mohr
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13
MovieReviews.Review: A tsunami looms both realistically and as a metaphor for the overwhelming surge of emotion rising from below the surface in the haunting Hereafter.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Hilary Swank, Sam Rockwell, Minnie Driver, Peter Gallagher, Melissa Leo
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R
MovieReviews.Review: Hilary Swank is the epitome of conviction in a film in which the title refers both to an action by the justice system and the determination it took to fight back.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Bruce Willis, Helen Mirren, Morgan Freeman, Mary-Louise Parker, John Malkovich, Ernest Borgnine
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13
MovieReviews.Review: Greenlighting RED must have seemed like a good idea at the time.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Aaron Johnson, Kristin Scott Thomas, Anne-Marie Duff, Thomas Brodie Sangster
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R
MovieReviews.Review: He was a real nowhere boy, living in a nowhere land. But he had big plans.

MovieReviews.MovieName: It's Kind of a Funny Story
MovieReviews.ActorName: Keir Gilchrist, Zach Galifianakis, Emma Roberts, Viola Davis
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for mature thematic issues, sexual content, drug material and language
MovieReviews.Review:
Mental illness is not inherently funny. But people acting crazy can be.

It's Kind of a Funny Story is notable for the easy chemistry of its ensemble cast. And the title, based on Ned Vizzini's 2006 novel of the same name, sums it up deftly. There is both poignancy and humor sometimes at the same time in this tale of an emotionally stressed teen who checks himself into a mental hospital.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Katherine Heigl, Josh Duhamel, Josh Lucas, Christina Hendricks, Melissa McCarthy
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for sexual material, language and some drug content
MovieReviews.Review:
Katherine Heigl and Josh Duhamel have an appealing chemistry, but Life as We Know It is tripped up by awkwardly fusing a familiar sitcom scenario with a tragic premise.

Predicating an escapist romantic comedy on a realistic tragedy requires a nimble touch at the helm. Perhaps if Life had been made by, say, James Brooks, it would have worked. As written by Ian Deitchman and Kristin Rusk Robinson, the film offers predictable laughs before and after a jarring accide

MovieReviews.ActorName: Robert De Niro, Edward Norton, Milla Jovovich, Frances Conroy
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for strong sexuality and violence and pervasive language
MovieReviews.Review:
Nothing is etched in anything remotely resembling a hard surface in Stone .

Moral ambiguity and ethical compromise are at the heart of this meandering prison drama, but at a certain point we simply don't care anymore who is base and baser.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Diane Lane, John Malkovich, Dylan Walsh, Margo Martindale, Scott Glenn
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG for brief mild language
MovieReviews.Review:
He's not a horse, of course. He's Secretariat.

The tale of this glossy chestnut colt substitutes reverence for bona fide excitement. Diane Lane 's voice-over narration quotes from the book of Job while a handsome steed bursts through billowing clouds as if on a divine mission.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Chloe Grace Moretz, Kodi Smit-McPhee, Richard Jenkins, Elias Koteas
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for strong bloody horror violence, language and a brief sexual situation
MovieReviews.Review:
Despite being about vampires, Let Me In can feel chillingly real.

Maybe that's because stars Chloe Grace Moretz and >Kodi Smit-McPhee are terrific actors whose young eyes look as if they've seen more than they should. Maybe director Matt Reeves ( Cloverfield ) simply has a knack for monsters.

Or perhaps this is how kids would really react when they discover they cannot die or be sated.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Jesse Eisenberg, Andrew Garfield, Justin Timberlake
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for sexual content, drug and alcohol use and language
MovieReviews.Review:
In , screenwriter Aaron Sorkin examined the limits of honor. In The Social Network , he focuses on a few nerd men and their dishonorable behavior, single-minded ambition and greed.

Brilliantly directed by David Fincher , this provocative film probes the impetus for invention, the changing face of social interaction and the limits of friendship the old-fashioned kind and the version linking 500 million Facebook users.

MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG for some thematic material, mild language and incidental smoking
MovieReviews.Review:
Waiting for Superman begins with a simple question: What's four minus two?

The answer takes achingly long for Anthony, an elementary school student in inner-city Washington. Anthony isn't dumb; he's more thoughtful than just about any child you'll meet. He's simply applying what he learned in public school. Which isn't much.

MovieReviews.MovieName: Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole
MovieReviews.ActorName: Helen Mirren, Jim Sturgess, Hugo Weaving
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG for some sequences of scary action
MovieReviews.Review: Beautifully drawn and devoid of his typical body count, Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole finds a wholly unexpected sweet spot for director Zack Snyder : the family film.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Kristen Bell, Jamie Lee Curtis, Sigourney Weaver, Victor Garber, Odette Yustman, Betty White
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG for brief mild language  and rude behavior
MovieReviews.Review:
Certainly you never forgive or forget the school bully who tormented you.

You also probably don't hurl dishes at that person a decade after the incidents have passed. Or turn an argument into a goopy food fight.

That setup is at the heart of the harmless, predictable but not-very-funny romp that is You Again .

MovieReviews.ActorName: Philip Seymour Hoffman, Amy Ryan, John Ortiz, Daphne Rubin-Vega
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for language, drug use and some sexual content
MovieReviews.Review:
Jack Goes Boating but he doesn't rock it much.

Maybe that's because it's Philip Seymour Hoffman 's directorial debut. Maybe it's because Hoffman doesn't rock anything. The actor ( Capote , Doubt ) can be so subtle as to be laconic.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Ryan Reynolds
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for language and some violent content
MovieReviews.Review:
It goes without saying that if you're looking for light, escapist entertainment, don't go see a movie about a man trapped in a coffin.

But those drawn to unusual, unflinching feats of filmmaking and rare acting turns as well as sustained suspense will be captivated by Buried .

MovieReviews.ActorName: Shia LaBeouf, Michael Douglas, Josh Brolin, Carey Mulligan
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for brief strong language and thematic elements
MovieReviews.Review:
The last time we saw Gordon Gekko, greed was good, his cellphone was the size of a pay phone, and the Wall Street shark had a quarter to spend in the joint.

Now, 23 years later, he's back in Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps . And despite director Oliver Stone 's sermons, Michael Douglas is just enough to make the trip worth the money.

MovieReviews.MovieName: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
MovieReviews.ActorName: Naomi Watts, Josh Brolin, Anthony Hopkins, Gemma Jones, Lucy Punch
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for some language
MovieReviews.Review:
It won't be a very enchanted evening at You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger .

Woody Allen's 41st feature film is just not as funny, charming or original as one might hope, given his genius and the pedigree of his cast. It's a rehash of well-worn Allen territory marital dissatisfaction and extramarital lust that is slight and only sporadically amusing.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Ben Affleck, Rebecca Hall, Jon Hamm, Blake Lively, Jeremy Renner
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for strong violence, pervasive language, some sexuality and drug use
MovieReviews.Review:
Apparently Thomas Wolfe was not altogether right. Some people can go home again. And it's our gain when they do.

Ben Affleck is one of those people. The actor/director again explores his Boston hometown in a steadily tense action thriller/romance based on Chuck Hogan's novel.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Emma Stone, Thomas Haden Church, Amanda Bynes, Lisa Kudrow
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for mature thematic elements involving teen sexuality, language and some drug material
MovieReviews.Review:
Easy A not only makes the grade, but it comes in close to 100%.

It also shows girls can be as funny as boys, something most of us know but Hollywood hasn't often put to the test.

The film is full of sharp wit that stops short of snark. And like any good movie, it transcends its genre.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Justin Long, Hayden Panettiere, Dennis Hopper, Danny Glover, Christina Ricci
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG for rude humor and some mild action.
MovieReviews.Review:
Alpha and Omega is one of those rarities in the modern era of Hollywood animation: bad.

Not good-bad, like Showgirls or The Expendables , movies that relish their pabulum.

MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for some sexual references
MovieReviews.Review:
To avoid revealing too much and spoiling a fresh and intriguing experience, let's just say this: Catch Catfish .

This suspenseful documentary about a virtual friendship could be a companion piece to the upcoming The Social Network . It inspires thought about our collective involvement with sites such as Facebook , with its unique blend of anonymity and unprecedented access to the most personal information. It has something profound to say about human relationships

MovieReviews.ActorName: Keira Knightley, Carey Mulligan, Andrew Garfield
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for some sexuality and nudity
MovieReviews.Review:
Say this for Never Let Me Go : It never does.

Based on the grim novel by Kazuo Ishiguro , Go doesn't embrace the book's unrelentingly dark tones as much as it wallows in them. Our heroes are so subdued and our villains so invisible that it's hard to muster much sympathy for this future world.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Katie Holmes, Josh Duhamel, Anna Paquin, Malin Akerman, Adam Brody, Elijah Wood
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for sexual content, partial nudity, language and some drug material
MovieReviews.Review:
The Romantics is a misnomer. "The Spoiled Melodramatics" would be more accurate. Or better yet, "The Pretentious Ones."

Neither the film nor its 30ish characters, former members of a tight college clique, come off as romantic. Entitled and bland, yes. Passionate, hardly. Can Yale grads possibly be this vapid?

MovieReviews.ActorName: John Cena, Patricia Clarkson, Devon Graye, Danny Glover
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for suggestive material, brief partial nudity and some fighting scenes
MovieReviews.Review:
For a movie with a star wrestler at the center of it, Legendary doesn't pack much of a punch.

It isn't for lack of swinging. Clearly, World Wrestling Entertainment, which produced the film, hopes to turn champion John Cena into a family star in the same vein as Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson .

MovieReviews.ActorName: Joaquin Phoenix
MovieReviews.MPAARating: Unrated
MovieReviews.Review:
It's really not much fun in fact it's painful to watch an actor on the verge of a nervous breakdown.

It almost doesn't matter if the psyche in question is imploding artificially as in staged or organically. It's just so unpleasant to watch two hours of unrelenting bad behavior and grandiose delusions.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Drew Barrymore, Justin Long, Christina Applegate, Jason Sudeikis
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for sexual content, including dialogue, language throughout, some drug use and brief nudity
MovieReviews.Review:
With good chemistry between likable leads and some timely recession-era professional woes, Going the Distance should be more of a contender.

But it stops short of the finish line, burying its romantic-comedy assets under calculated efforts to be socially relevant and vulgar attempts at humor.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Danny Trejo, Jessica Alba, Robert De Niro, Michelle Rodriguez, Steven Seagal, Jeff Fahey, Lindsay Lohan, Don Johnson, Cheech Marin
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for strong bloody violence throughout, language, some sexual content and nudity
MovieReviews.Review:
Machete don't text. But he does improvise.

Danny Trejoplays the long-haired, craggy-faced titular Machete with a combination of swift ferocity and baleful kindliness. And the ladies love it.

MovieReviews.ActorName: George Clooney, Violante Placido, Paolo Bonacelli, Thekla Reuten
MovieReviews.MPAARating: R for violence, sexual content and nudity
MovieReviews.Review:
Inner turmoil and somber introspection are not usually George Clooney 's on-screen specialties. Nor is he often associated with arty, foreign films.

The actor known for his charm and easy wit shows neither as the titular man of few words in The American .

MovieReviews.ActorName: Patrick Fabian, Ashley Bell, Louis Herthum, Iris Bahr, Caleb Landry Jones
MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for disturbing violent content and terror, some sexual references and thematic material
MovieReviews.Review: Satan gets behind The Last Exorcism in a fiendishly clever plot that starts out creepily enthralling, then collapses in a heap.

MovieReviews.MPAARating: PG-13 for intense sequences of violence and action, a sexual situation/partial nudity and some language
MovieReviews.Review: Apparently, take and keep on taking. Don't ever mistake these cocky guys for a bunch of givers.Their philosophy is summed up succinctly by one of the smooth criminals: "We're takers. That's what we do: We take."
